DOCNAME: CASE OF ERYK KAWKA v. POLAND
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 5-3;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested by the police and brought before ORG ( Prokurator Rejonowy ) . On DATE , the prosecutor charged the applicant with robbery and detained him on remand because there existed a reasonable suspicion that he had committed the offence and because of the serious nature of that offence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sent a letter to the LOC prosecutor , asking to be informed of the reasons for his detention . That letter was deemed to be an application for release . It was examined as such and rejected on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was indicted on the charge of robbery .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment and DATE deprivation of his civic rights .
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law is described in the judgment PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE and DATE , DATE , unreported .
